thread.title: First clinical trial of vosoritide for children with hypochondroplasia shows increased growth | News | bakersfield.com
thread.title_full: First clinical trial of vosoritide for children with hypochondroplasia shows increased growth | News | bakersfield.com

author: Children's National Hospital - (GLOBE NEWSWIRE)
title: First clinical trial of vosoritide for children with hypochondroplasia shows increased growth | News | bakersfield.com
text: WASHINGTON, April 11, 2024 (GLOBE NEWSWIRE) -- Vosoritide’s first global phase 2 study showed an average increased growth rate of 1.8 cm per year in children with hypochondroplasia, a genetic cause of short stature in children, according to researchers from Children’s National Hospital. “This is the first medicine that has been developed to specifically target the pathway involved in hypochondroplasia,” says Andrew Dauber, M.D. , chief of Endocrinology at Children’s National. “These findings will help inform future studies of vosoritide for addressing growth disorders.” kAm%9:D 4=:?:42= EC:2= 7F?565 3J q:@|2C:? :D E96 7:CDE\@7\:ED\ 7@F?5 E96 2??F2=:K65 8C@HE9 G6=@4:EJ :?4C62D65 3J a]ae DE2?52C5 56G:2E:@?
